 Merits:
   

  

* Experience of capacity development projects
* Knowledge about the educational system in Sweden for rescue services
* Understanding of integrating of cross-cutting issues, such as gender equality, human rights and environmental perspectives into CBRN work
* Working experience in Ukraine or the nearby region


**Education**
* Minimum a Bachelor degree in chemistry, biology, physics, engineering, or a related field.
* Specific courses in organisational development and change management studies is an asset.


**Languages**
* Proficiency written and spoken English is a mandatory requirement.
* Ukrainian and/or Russian is desirable.


**Other Requirements**
 We are looking for persons with a strong commitment towards international cooperations. It is of utmost priority that you understand, respect and act in the spirit of the mandate and core values of the MSB.
   

  

 Prior to employment a medical examination must be carried out and the results must be approved by the MSB. Certain diseases and conditions can preclude international deployment. If you have any questions regarding the MSB:s health requirements, please contact our medical coordinators, medical.coordinator@msb.se
   

  

 You must inform your regular employer of your potential assignment with the MSB. MSB operations are based on the needs of populations affected by crisis, and human equality. Through your behaviour and work as MSB field staff, you must actively strive to prevent discrimination and harassment based on sex, ethnic origin, age, religion or belief, political opinion, disability, sexual orientation and gender identity or expression.
   

  

**Profile**
* You have strong communicative and interpersonal skills, ability to act with tact and diplomacy, open-minded approach, and respect towards cultural differences.
* You have the ability to work independently and as a part of a team, also under stressful circumstances.
* You have strong analytical skills as well as practical “hands-on” approach to addressing tasks.


 We place great emphasis on personal qualities and suitability in this recruitment process.
   

  

**Contractual conditions**
 Working with the MSB on international operations means that you are temporarily employed by the MSB. The MSB pays monthly salary as well as a comprehensive allowances and benefits package to field staff on international operations. In addition, participants on induction training and relevant specialist training courses receive remuneration from the MSB.
   

  

 HOW TO APPLY:
   

  

 If you wish to apply to this position, you first need to create an account on MyPages. Please note; the information that you provide on MyPages will form the basis for your CV. When you have created your account and registered your CV-details on MyPages you submit your application by clicking on the "Apply" button in the add, and the follow the specified steps. If you already have an account on Mypages you can go directly to Apply-botton. If you find any trouble with MyPages, please contact our support; mypages@msb.se
   

  

 It is your responsibility as an applicant to document your skills in a way that allows an objective and qualitative assessment. As a government agency we are subject to the principle of public access to official records. This means that if someone requests copies of application documents, we are obliged to disclose them. If your identity is protected, you should contact the HR officer stated below, before registering any information on MyPages.
   

  

 Please note that applications will be continuously reviewed when received up until the application deadline. Therefore, we encourage all candidates to submit their application as soon as possible.
   

  

 If you have any questions, please contact HR Officer:
   

  

 Amanda Jansson, phone +46 10 240 5446 or e-mail: amanda.jansson@msb.se
   

  

 We are looking forward to your application!
   

  

**Application deadline**
 2025-03-17
   

  

**Point of contact**
 Amanda Jansson
   

  

 Amanda.Jansson@msb.se
   

  

 +46102405446

title: Clinical Application Manager Getinge, Solna
company_industry: Medical Equipment Manufacturing, Biotechnology Research, and Hospitals and Health Care
description:
**With a passion for life**
 Join our diverse teams of passionate people and a career that allows you to develop both personally and professionally. At Getinge we exist to make life-saving technology accessible for more people. To make a true difference for our customers – and to save more lives, we need team players, forward thinkers, and game changers.
   

  

 Are you looking for an inspiring career? You just found it.
   

  

 We are currently looking for a self-driven and open-minded Clinical Application Manager to join our team in Solna (Stockholm), Sweden, as part of the IABP (Intra-Aortic Balloon pump) product portfolio at Getinge. We are the center of excellency for live saving products within Intensive Care units.
   

  

 We at Getinge believe in self-organized and cross-functional teams, adopting to lean and agile methods in product development and project management. Our vision is to successfully realize customer value in medical technology in a fast changing and complex environment.
   

  

 This role will closely collaborate with other international Getinge sites and daily cooperation with our clients is key and occasional International travel is required. Location is in Solna outside Stockholm and we provide you a hybrid setup with the possibility to work remotely 1-2 days /week.
   

  

**Your main tasks**
* Be the Clinical Application Specialist for Product Management
* Support the team with clinical knowledge related to intra-aortic balloon pump therapy.
* Participate throughout the product development process
* Help drive the product development priorities and be the first to test new products and features
* Develop and maintain the clinical content used to train and educate our sales and clinical representatives as well as health care providers


**What You Bring**
* Formal clinical education with a focus in cardiovascular disease, e.g. specialist nurse
* Minimum five years clinical experience with intra-aortic balloon pumps or similar
* Experience in trainings and coaching
* High customer orientation
* Fluent written and spoken English and preferably also Swedish


 Located in Stockholm area or the surrounding areas that also allows to work on-site in Solna on minimum 2-3 days a week.
   

  

**Application**
 Applications will be reviewed continually, and we therefore recommend sending us your application as soon as possible. If you have any questions regarding the position, please contact Hiring Manager Joie Meikle by email: joie.meikle@getinge.com or recruiter Emma Paulsson at emma.paulsson@getinge.com .
   

  

 We kindly ask you to submit your application in our recruitment system by clicking the “apply now” button. Due to GDPR regulations we do not accept applications via e-mail.
   

  

**About Us**
 With a firm belief that every person and community should have access to the best possible care, Getinge provides hospitals and life science institutions with products and solutions aiming to improve clinical results and optimize workflows. The offering includes products and solutions for intensive care, cardiovascular procedures, operating rooms, sterile reprocessing and life science. Getinge employs over 12,000 people worldwide and the products are sold in more than 135 countries.
   

  

 Reasonable accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

title: Game Designer - Crusader Kings 3
description:
**Your Mission**
 As a
 **Game Designer** 
 on the Crusader Kings III team in Stockholm, you will be working towards the vision set by the Game Director, finding the solutions for game systems and in-game content that live up to the expectations of our players. You will achieve this by collaborating with other developers and with an ability to convey design through excellent communication and teamwork. You will also work with implementing your solutions in the game engine making sure it is balanced and working as intended.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Designing and implementing gameplay systems using our in-house scripting language in coordination with other game designers
* Writing and Scripting short narratives, and adding other types of content to the gameplay systems
* Understanding our players and finding the fun to add player value


**Requirements**
* Professional experience as a Game Designer on a game team (or similar modding experience)
* Experience with writing text for in-game content in (American) English
* Proficiency with scripting for game content
* Deep and genuine interest in strategy games. You have played the Crusader Kings franchise extensively.


**Work Culture**
 We are dedicated to crafting thought-provoking games that our players adore and are eager to enjoy endlessly. Every member of the Paradox team is committed to contributing their best and sharing the drive to achieve our goals, reaching new pinnacles as a united force. Creativity, autonomy, and self-initiation are the building blocks of our game development process, all made feasible by a substantial foundation of trust. We are establishing this trust-based environment by having faith in our colleagues to act with the best of intentions.
   

  

 Our culture evolves through our engagements with our players and our deep understanding of their desires and expectations. We're dedicated to comprehending our players and what they truly cherish in our games, as well as their mindset while enjoying them.
   

  

**Practical information**
 Scope: Full time and permanent
   

  

 Reports to: Design Manager
   

  

 Location: Stockholm
   

  

**We do not offer relocation for this position.**
 Today, Paradox consists of both publishing and internal game development. We have a broad portfolio of games and own the most important brands, including Stellaris, Europa Universalis, Hearts of Iron, Crusader Kings, Cities: Skylines, Prison Architect, Victoria, Age of Wonders and the World of Darkness catalog of brands.
   

  

 Since 2004, the company has published its games all over the world, initially through physical distribution but primarily in digital channels after 2006. Paradox games are developed primarily for PC and console platforms, but the company also releases games on mobile. The largest markets today include the US, UK, China, Germany, France and Scandinavia. In total, Paradox games have over five million players each month.

title: Fleet Specialist, Hybrid
description:
**Your mission at Voi**
**Responsibilities**
 For the position as a
 **Fleet Specialist** 
 , you'll have the possibility of working in two different areas, depending on workload and suitability. We have our mechanical team, where you will be responsible for the maintenance and repair of our vehicles. This means keeping our scooters in top shape and provide strong support to our team on the ground. We also have our In field team, where you'll be utilising our vans to perform different tasks in the
 **Stockholm** 
 area, making sure our operations runs as efficiently as possible. Here are some exciting tasks awaiting you as a Fleet Specialist:
   

  

* Ensuring the logistics of collecting and providing Voi scooters.⚙️
* Searching for and collecting damaged scooters. 🛴
* Battery replacement.🔋
* Performing quick on-site repairs of the scooters.🔧
* Diagnosing and repairing broken vehicles.🔧
* Recycling and dismantling vehicles that cannot be repaired. ♻️
* Assisting with the acceptance, packaging, and provision of new vehicles and batteries arriving at the warehouse. 🔍
* Supporting our on-site team as needed, whether it's identifying damaged vehicles, clearing parking spaces, or setting up fallen vehicles.🤝


**What You'll Need To Embark**
 We're looking for a highly motivated and responsible team player who can handle tasks and solve problems independently. With a proactive approach, you should be skilled in finding innovative solutions and achieving set objectives. In addition, the right candidate should have:
   

  

* A valid drivers license for Sweden
* Fluent english, both verbal and written and if you're fluent in Swedish it's a plus
* Previous experience with tools or mechanical practices
* General familiarity with digital tools and applications
* Local knowledge of Stockholm and experience driving in the city
* The ability to remain calm in stressful situations (such as difficult parking or traffic)


**Job conditions**
* Working hours: Full- and part time positions
* Contract type: Fixed term contract
* Start date: To be discussed


**Why Voi?**
 Working At Voi Is More Than Just a Job; It's a Personal Voiage Where You'll Grow As a Professional And Be Part Of a Diverse Team And Culture That's Committed To Making a Positive Impact On Society. In Addition To This, You'll Have The Opportunity To
   

  

* Join Europe's leading micromobility company and one of the fastest-growing scale-ups
* Make a direct impact on our ongoing success and contribute to the development of the micromobility industry in Sweden.
* Collaborate with inspiring, motivated, and diverse colleagues who share a common goal
* Be a part of the micromobility revolution and help create sustainable cities that are clean, quiet, and free from pollution


**Are you ready to embark on the Voiage with us?**
 Since 2018,
 **Voi** 
 has been on a mission to create safe, sustainable and reliable micromobility for everyone. Today we are the leading shared micromobility operator in Europe, with HQ in Stockholm (Sweden), operating 100,000+ vehicles in 100+ towns and cities across 12 countries, serving 7+ million riders with over 300+ MILLION rides to date, and we have no intention of stopping here! We believe that micromobility will play a central role in changing how people move in our towns and cities in the future and want to ensure that the micromobility transformation happens the right way - through real innovative technology, partnership and transparent dialogue with towns, cities and governments, and by adapting our products to the local needs. In addition to improving quality of life in cities around the world, we are contributing to the solution for climate change by making sustainable transportation options more widely available and promoting renewable energy use and circularity along our supply chain.
   

  

**Diversity Matters**
 As a Voiager, we offer you a friendly and fast-paced workplace where you can bring your whole self to work, regardless of gender, age, ethnicity, religion, disability or sexual orientation - and welcome applications from whoever you are, including veterans, those actively serving as a Reservist and their partners. What is most important to us is how you treat others and what skills and value you bring to our team. We believe that having a wide diversity of people with different backgrounds and perspectives within Voi is essential to our success in delivering the best user experience to our equally diverse user base. With employees from over 50 nationalities working within Voi, we believe we have made good progress but know we can still do more - therefore we discourage any photos, personal letters, or disclosure of any information that concerns other information than your professional experience.

title: Post-Trade Client Relationship & Services Associate
description:
**About The Role**
**Position:** 
 Client Manager Triresolve
   

  

**Level:** 
 Associate
   

  

**Department:** 
 Client Relationship and Services Triresolve
   

  

**Reporting To:** 
 Client Relationship and Services Team Leader Triresolve
   

  

**Company Overview**
 For OTC derivatives, our services focus on lowering costs, eliminating operational and credit risk, improving counterparty exposure management, and reducing systemic risk. triReduce reduces swap inventory and counterparty risk; triResolve reconciles OTC derivative portfolios, manages disputes, validates repository data, and automates margin management; triBalance manages cleared and bilateral counterparty risk while triCalculate measures and analyses counterparty risk.
   

  

 For more information, go to trioptima.com
   

  

**Role Summary**
 The candidate will have both a meticulous attention to detail and an understanding of financial products. Knowledge about OTC derivatives, risk and technical ability is desirable. Good written and verbal communication skills in English are a must. Candidates with prior experience of collateral management, fund administration and/or regulatory are especially welcome to apply for the position.
   

  

 The triResolve Client Relationship and Services team is the first line of contact for our clients with regards to the delivery of the triResolve OTC derivative portfolio reconciliation service. The Client Manager will provide support to our clients and work closely with the product, business, development, and sales teams globally and thus the role varies to account for regional characteristics.
   

  

 Client Relationship and Services is responsible for the smooth and timely running of the triResolve service. This team of dedicated staff is in continuous dialogue with major financial institutions worldwide, as well as other internal departments, with regards to features and upcoming events as well as any changes or developments to any aspects of the service such as, for example, the specification of the data that the subscribers will send or receive, or how the service integrates with other services or utilities in the OTC Derivatives space. Similarly, Client Relationship and Services must continually stay abreast of any market or client events, activities or changes that potentially affect our service or our clients’ use of our offering or ability to participate. In addition, Client Relationship and Services has an important role in collecting input for new and enhanced functionalities to the service as well as other new service offerings.
   

  

 In summary, triResolve Client Relationship and Services is responsible for pre-sales and client on-boarding, service delivery, customer success management as well as workflow/ product and productivity improvements. This can only be delivered by a highly skilled individual as well as close collaboration with Business Management, Product Management, Development and Sales teams.
   

  

**Key Accountabilities**
* On-boarding
* Assisting Sales in pre-sales process, meeting prospect clients, organizing demos
* Client onboarding and testing
* Ownership of selected accounts
* Daily assistance to owned subscribers (via email, phone and in person)
* Trade data normalisation / handling
* Review reconciliation output; investigate and fix differences
* Ensure structured and effective delivery of service
* Self- education about current and upcoming market regulations and other significant changes
* Customer Success Management
* Regular client calls and client visits onsite
* Perform customer health checks, understanding client’s process and needs
* Client trainings when needed via onsite visit or webinars
* Promote comprehensive and more effective usage of the service in collaboration with Business Management and Sales teams
* Participate in key business initiatives
* Productivity/ Workflow Improvements
* Raise internal request for new functionalities to improve the product offering
* Assist developers and Product Management with requirements and UAT testing as well as being closely involved in the development process


**Skills**
* Customer relationship skills
* The ability to interpret trade data
* Ability to think outside the box and challenge existing status quo
* Proficiency in using text editors and advanced spreadsheet functions
* Ability to work in a fast pace environment
* Good communication skills (verbal and written English)
* Fluency in another language would be beneficial
* Good customer relationship skills
* The ability to understand complex process flows and concepts, as well as the ability to explain these accurately and concisely to our clients
* Knowledge of OTC Derivatives and understanding of the trade data fields of these instruments as well as awareness of the OTC Derivative trade processing lifecycle would be beneficial
* Basic understanding of market and credit risk management of OTC Derivatives, such as yield curves and valuation would be beneficial
* Good understanding of computer logics and database structures and/or interest in technology
* Previous experience with triResolve or similar relevant background


**About OSTTRA**
*Candidates should note that OSTTRA is an independent firm, jointly owned by S&P Global and CME Group. As part of the joint venture, S&P Global provides recruitment services to OSTTRA - however, successful candidates will be interviewed and directly employed by OSTTRA, joining our global team of more than 1,200 post trade experts.*
 OSTTRA was formed in 2021 through the combination of four businesses that have been at the heart of post trade evolution and innovation for the last 20+ years: MarkitServ, Traiana, TriOptima and Reset. OSTTRA is a joint venture, owned 50/50 by S&P Global and CME Group.
   

  

 With an outstanding track record of developing and supporting critical market infrastructure, our combined network connects thousands of market participants to streamline end to end workflows - from trade capture at the point of execution, through portfolio optimization, to clearing and settlement.
   

  

 Joining the OSTTRA team is a unique opportunity to help build a bold new business with an outstanding heritage in financial technology, playing a central role in supporting global financial markets.
   

  

 Learn more at www.osttra.com.
   

  

**What’s In It For** 
**You?**
**Benefits**
 We take care of you, so you can take care of business. We care about our people. That’s why we provide everything you—and your career—need to thrive at S&P Global.
   

  

**Our Benefits Include**
* Health & Wellness: Health care coverage designed for the mind and body.
* Flexible Downtime: Generous time off helps keep you energized for your time on.
* Continuous Learning: Access a wealth of resources to grow your career and learn valuable new skills.
* Invest in Your Future: Secure your financial future through competitive pay, retirement planning, a continuing education program with a company-matched student loan contribution, and financial wellness programs.
* Family Friendly Perks: It’s not just about you. S&P Global has perks for your partners and little ones, too, with some best-in class benefits for families.
* Beyond the Basics: From retail discounts to referral incentive awards—small perks can make a big difference.


 For more information on benefits by country visit: https://spgbenefits.com/benefit-summaries
   

  

**Equal Opportunity Employer**
 S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race/ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other status protected by law. Only electronic job submissions will be considered for employment.
   

  

 If you need an accommodation during the application process due to a disability, please send an email to: EEO.Compliance@spglobal.com and your request will be forwarded to the appropriate person.
   

  

**US Candidates Only:** 
 The EEO is the Law Poster http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdf describes discrimination protections under federal law. Pay Transparency Nondiscrimination Provision - https://www.dol.gov/sites/dolgov/files/ofccp/pdf/pay-transp\_%20English\_formattedESQA508c.pdf
   

  

 20 - Professional (EEO-2 Job Categories-United States of America), BSMGMT203 - Entry Professional (EEO Job Group)
   

  

**Job ID:** 
 309256
   

  

**Posted On:** 
 2025-01-27
   

  

**Location:** 
 Stockholm, Sweden

title: Cloud & DevOps Lead
description:
Tendfor är en ledande aktör inom moderna, molnbaserade stödsystem för telefoni och contact center-funktioner integrerade i Microsoft Teams. Vi levererar innovativa lösningar som används av stora företag över hela Europa. Vi är ett gäng dedikerade medarbetare i Sverige samt experter i Belgien och USA, har en stabil ekonomi och en imponerande tillväxt på 40% de senaste åren.
  
Nu är vi i en spännande tillväxtfas och söker dig som vill ansvara för vår devops/cloud miljö.
  
Vi söker dig som pratar svenska och är svensk medborgare, du kan däremot utföra arbetet helt remote om du vill, eller från vårt kontor i centrala Stockholm.
  
  

**Mer om rollen:**  

Vi söker en erfaren och drivande DevOps & Cloud Lead med en bred bakgrund inom IT-drift och automation. I rollen får du ett stort eget ansvar och möjligheten att strategiskt forma och vidareutveckla våra tekniska lösningar.
  
  

**Det här är en nyckelposition där du får möjlighet att:**  

**Optimera och övervaka IT-miljön:** Ansvara för driften av våra system, nätverk, servermiljöer och säkerhetslösningar, med fokus på att upprätthålla hög tillgänglighet och robusthet.
  
  

**Driva automatisering:** Utveckla och implementera effektiva scriptlösningar (med exempelvis PowerShell och Azure DevOps) för att förbättra processer och öka driftseffektiviteten.
  
  

**Samarbeta med ett tekniskt expertteam:** Tillsammans med våra utvecklare, QA- och supportkollegor, identifiera förbättringsområden och driva utvecklingsinsatser som möter både nuvarande och framtida behov.
  
  

**Arbeta flexibelt:** Delta i dagliga standups och samarbeta med teamet, med möjlighet att arbeta remote från hela Sverige (kontoret finns på Kungsgatan 4 om du önskar vara på plats).
  
  

**Vi söker dig som:**  

Har gedigen erfarenhet av IT-drift och förvaltning med starkt fokus på Cloud-miljöer.
  
  

Är van vid att utveckla och implementera automatiseringslösningar med scriptning, exempelvis med PowerShell och Azure DevOps.
  
  

Är en självständig och ansvarstagande problemlösare med ett analytiskt sinne.
  
  

Har erfarenhet från roller där du hanterat kritiska system och har en förståelse för den dagliga driften i en global miljö.
  
  

Är kommunikativ och trivs med att samarbeta med både tekniska och icke-tekniska team.
  
  

Behärskar svenska och engelska obehindrat, både i tal och skrift.
  
  

Vad vi erbjuder dig?
  
**Stort eget ansvar:** En central roll där du självständigt driver strategiska initiativ och säkerställer att våra IT-lösningar håller högsta kvalitet.
  
  

**Innovativ och stabil arbetsplats:** En dynamisk miljö i en expansiv bransch, med god lönsamhet och en tydlig framtidsvision.
  
  

**Kontinuerlig utveckling:** Möjlighet till kompetensutveckling och att arbeta med de senaste teknologierna inom Microsoft-ekosystemet (.NET, C#, PowerShell, Azure DevOps) samt CRM Dynamics.
  
  

**Flexibla arbetsvillkor:** En hybridarbetsmiljö med möjlighet att arbeta remote från var som helst i Sverige.
  
  

**En del av ett passionerat team:** Du blir en del av ett dedikerat teknikteam med ett team i Sverige (inklusive produkransvarig, QA, teknisk support och utvecklare) där samarbetet och kontinuerlig förbättring står i fokus.
  
  

Ansökan
  
Är du redo att ta nästa steg i din karriär och vara en nyckelspelare i en spännande expansion? Tendfor samarbetar i denna rekrytering med House of Skills.
  
Har du frågor är du välkommen att kontakta våra rekryteringskonsulter:
  
Linda Freij – linda.freij@houseofskills.se
  
Linda Mukka – linda.mukka@houseofskills.se
  
  

Välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Digital Engineer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*  

  

**Job Description**  

* Set up and execute test processes for mobile applications primarily and secondary other digital / R&D deliveries.
* Manage software and backend setup in development, staging, and production


environments.  

* Conduct fault tracing and troubleshooting related to infotainment, connectivity, and


vehicle software systems.  

* Document and report error tracing activities.
* Actively monitor incidents and potential threats.
* Ensure vehicle compatibility for connected car features, including Google Automotive


Services and cloud-based services.  

* Provide technical expertise in test object management, software download (SWDL), and system validation.
* Support end-to-end testing for cloud connectivity, infotainment systems, and mobile


applications.  

* Coordinate test setups, including test object (car/rig) configuration, software upgrades,


and validation processes.  

* Work closely with development teams to support agile methodologies


(Scrum/Kanban/SAFe).  

  

**Your Profile (Must-have requirements)**  

* We are looking for a candidate with: 10+ years of experience in system integration,


testing, and fault tracing, with a focus on infotainment, connectivity, and thermal  

management systems.  

* Strong background in connected car cloud architecture and automotive software


development.  

* Expertise in system validation, verification, and troubleshooting, particularly in CAN, LIN, FlexRay, and cloud-based connectivity.
* Experience with tools such as CANoe, CANalyzer, JIRA, Splunk, VIDA, Techtool
* Solid knowledge of wireless car portals, SWDL, and test environment setup.
* Experience with Google Automotive Services and mobile app testing.
* Strong communication skills, with a proactive, problem-solving mindset.
* Previous experience in leading technical discussions, working cross-functionally, and


supporting Agile development teams.  

* A valid driver’s license in Sweden.

  

**Meritorious**  

* Certifications in Product Ownership (Scrum/Agile) and SAFe methodologies.
* Experience working in press event preparations, factory validations, or remote test


environments.  

* Proven experience in mobile app testing, especially in the context of electric vehicle


applications is a plus.  

* Familiarity with iOS and Android platforms, and experience with various mobile devices


and operating systems.  

* Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
* Knowledge of software testing methodologies, tools, and best practices.
* Excellent communication skills to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams.
* Strong analytical skills to identify, document, and track software defects.
* A passion for electric vehicles and an understanding of the EV industry is a plus.
* Familiar with Jira, Confluence and related workflows.

  

**Application deadline:** 26-02-2025  

  

**About Us**  

We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.  

  

Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?  

  

We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!  

  



**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**


Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.


A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.


Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.


Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.


Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?


Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.


Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.


Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Quality Assurance Manager till Pulsen Omsorg
description:
**Om Pulsen Omsorg**  

Pulsen Omsorg tänker större än enskilda tjänster. Vi vill erbjuda verktyg som skapar mer tid för omsorg i omsorgen. För att möjliggöra ett effektivt digitalt ekosystem ligger fokus på standardisering och sömlös integration där olika tjänster knyts samman och kan förvaltas på ett långsiktigt hållbart sätt. Pulsen Omsorgs målbild för framtidens välfärd täcker hela omsorgskedjan – från behov och aktualiseringar till åtgärder och information som hjälper den enskilde i dess specifika livssituation. Denna hjälp skapas med individen i centrum och med dennes aktiva deltagande i processen. Genom att tillhandahålla plattformen Combine som ett nav i det digitala ekosystemet är vårt strategiska mål att vara den naturliga partnern för alla samhällets aktörer inom omsorg och välfärd.


Vi har experterna som knyter ihop verksamhetskunskap med realisering av tjänster för den sociala välfärden. Vi besitter unik kunskap och förståelse för omsorgens utmaningar samt möjligheterna som tekniken ger oss. Digital omsorg är vår nisch. Vi har 30 års erfarenhet och är en organisation bestående av passionerade medarbetare med vitt skilda specialistkunskaper. Vi kan säkert tyckas olika. Men vi har alla sökt oss hit av samma anledning: För att få chansen att göra skillnad. Riktig skillnad, för andra människor. Det är därför vi har både viljan, kunskapen och kapaciteten att realisera den digitala omsorgen idag. Och imorgon. En välfungerande, smart och medmänsklig välfärd är viktigt för alla: För den enskilda individen i behov av stöd. För anhöriga. För personal. Och för samhället i stort.

**Vad innebär rollen?**  

Som Quality Assurance Manager kommer du att ansvara för att säkerställa att våra produkter och tjänster håller högsta möjliga kvalitet. Du kommer att utveckla och implementera en övergripande kvalitetsstrategi som integrerar kvalitetsaspekter tidigt i produktutvecklingen och säkerställer att vi når upp till våra mål. Du kommer att planera och leda olika testaktiviteter, inklusive funktionstest, regressionstest och automatiserade tester för att upprätthålla våra kvalitetsstandarder.


Har du erfarenhet som ledare inom kvalitetssäkring och passionerad för att bygga robusta kvalitetsstrategier? Vi söker nu en Quality Assurance Manager som vill spela en central roll i att utveckla och implementera kvalitetsprocesser för att säkerställa att våra produkter och tjänster alltid uppfyller högsta möjliga standard. Hos oss får du möjlighet att leda ett dedikerat team och sätta din prägel på vårt kvalitetsarbete

* **Kvalitetsstrategi och testplanering**: Du utvecklar en kvalitetsstrategi och planerar testaktiviteter som inkluderar både manuella och automatiserade tester.
* **Testmetoder och automation**: Du implementerar testmetoder som BDD (Behavior-Driven Development) och TDD (Test-Driven Development) och driver testautomatisering för att effektivisera kvalitetsarbetet.
* **Kommunikation och samarbete**: Du fungerar som en brygga mellan utvecklingsteam och intressenter för att säkerställa att kvalitet prioriteras i hela utvecklingsprocessen.
* **Testmiljöer och verktyg**: Du hanterar testmiljöer och använder automatiseringsverktyg för att säkerställa att alla delar av utvecklingen testas noggrant och effektivt.

**Vi söker dig som har:**

* Minst fem års erfarenhet av kvalitetssäkring inom mjukvaruutveckling, med fokus på både manuella och automatiserade testprocesser.
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av att leda och utveckla QA-team samt att skapa och implementera QA-strategier.
* Praktisk erfarenhet av automatiseringsverktyg som Selenium, Postman, Cypress eller liknande, och vana vid att använda dessa i dagliga arbetsflöden.
* Erfarenhet av CI/CD-pipelines och verktyg som Jenkins, GitLab CI eller Azure DevOps för att integrera testautomation.
* Erfarenhet av molnplattformar såsom Azure eller AWS, särskilt i testmiljöer.
* Djupgående kunskap inom olika typer av testning: funktionella, icke-funktionella, regressionstester, prestandatester och säkerhetstester.
* Erfarenhet av att hantera testmiljöer och konfigurera testscenarier för att säkerställa att systemet är robust, skalbart och säkert.

**Meriterande erfarenheter:**

* Erfarenhet av testdriven utveckling (TDD) och beteendedriven utveckling (BDD**)**, gärna med ramverk som Cucumber eller SpecFlow.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med mikrotjänstbaserade system och containeriserade miljöer som Kubernetes och Docker.
* Erfarenhet av avancerade prestandatester och användning av verktyg som JMeter, Gatling eller LoadRunner.
* Erfarenhet av säkerhetstestning, med fokus på OWASP-toppen och verktyg som OWASP ZAP eller Burp Suite.
* Kännedom om ISO 27001 eller andra kvalitetssäkringsstandarder samt regulatoriska krav som GDPR.

**Personliga egenskaper:**

  

* Strukturerad och analytisk, med förmåga att identifiera riskområden och förbättra kvalitetssäkringsprocesser.
* En erfaren ledare som vet hur man skapar och bibehåller en kvalitetskultur inom hela utvecklingsorganisationen.
* Kommunikativ och samarbetsvillig, med erfarenhet av att arbeta i tvärfunktionella team och säkerställa att alla parter är med på samma mål.
* Drivande och engagerad i att förbättra processer och säkerställa att kvalitet genomsyrar hela systemutvecklingen.


I den här rekrytering samarbetar Pulsen Omsorg med M-R Partner och har du frågor eller funderingar gällande tjänsten så är du välkommen att kontakta Marc Magnusson på 0707-972718 alt marc@mrpartner.se  

Vi intervjuar löpande så tveka inte på att höra av dig!

title: Lead DevOps Engineer - Full time EMPLOYMEENT
description:
Build the DevOps team from scratch for this social MMO.


Start off by being hands on and build the infrastructure and over time build out your own team.


**Game Boost**
--------------

### **Enabling Smooth Game Production**


We provide remote-friendly studios with stellar game developers in all crafts.

 *Free to check us out on* *LinkedIn*

 **Mission brief:**

* Building and maintaining Kubernetes / Helm definitions / Terraform.
* Managing Azure Kubernetes Service infrastructure.  

	+ Creating / maintaining Azure DevOps based CI/CD pipeline.
	+ Managing resources (Clusters, VMs, Databases, etc.) on Azure.
	+ Making sure services are running around the clock (Handle alerts)
	+ Using existing and new monitoring tools to improve the uptime of our systems.
	+ Building scripts to automate pipelines and processes.
	+ Working closely with server and game teams to build and support gaming products.
	+ Maintaining and expanding infrastructure as code and configuration management toolset.


**Details:**

* Start date: February / March
* Duration: Full time employment
* Occupancy rate: 100% assignment (Full-time)
* Level: Senior / Lead
* Work set-up: Remote within CET

  




**Your player profile:**

* Passion for leadership
* Comfortable and skilled at giving and receiving constructive feedback
* 5+ years of experience with Azure cloud environments
* 5+ years of experience with DevOps tools and release engineering  

	+ 5+ years of experience with Kubernetes
	+ 3+ years of experience with infrastructure/pipeline as code and best practices
	+ 3+ years of experience in leading high performing teams
	+ Experience with infrastructure as code (Terraform)
	+ Understanding/experience with web services, databases and relating infrastructure/architectures
	+ Scripting skills with PowerShell / Bash
	+ Coding skills with Golang or equivalent
	+ Deep understanding of networking concepts, both on premises and in the cloud, i.e., load balancers, Azure Application Gateways, WAF, DNS, subnets/vnets, etc.


**Traits:**

  

* Proactive mindset with strong initiative to identify and solve problems  

	+ Attention to detail
	+ Ability to take ownership of responsibilities
	+ Collaborative and consensus-driven approach

 ***Note:***


We believe that the world of gaming *can* and *should* include everyone.

*Neither Game Boost, nor our clients tolerate toxic, intolerant behavior* ️

**How to Play!**


It's quick and simple since we aim for low manual data entry!


This means that you can use your LinkedIn or upload a profile of your liking.


Fill in a couple of choice questions that will help us get to know you, your skills, and also understand the basics, like when you're available, location, etc.


Yeah, that's it.


Buzz: Game Project, Assignment, Gig, Creator, Developer, Contractor, Freelancer, Self-employed, Consultant, Work-For-Hire, Co-Development, Programmer, Scripter, Software Engineer, Backend, Frontend, Fullstack, Unreal Developer, C++, UE4, UE5, Unity, Frostbite, Snowflake, Maya, Blender, Computer Games, Mobile Games, Careers in gaming, hitmarker, game jobs, remote game jobs, Google jobs

title: Enterprise Architect
description:
**Position Summary**


We’re looking for an Enterprise Architect to guide the technical direction of our B2B SaaS platform. You will take on significant responsibility in setting priorities, defining best practices, and ensuring successful software delivery. Our product is unique, demanding a high level of collaboration and advanced problem-solving. You’ll work closely with our exceptionally skilled architect and a senior team of developers to refine and shape robust, scalable solutions. As our R&D department evolves, we're looking for someone who embraces change, adapts quickly to shifting priorities, and brings a forward-thinking mindset

**Key Responsibilities**


**Technical Direction & Prioritization** – Shape the overall architectural vision while ensuring scalability and maintainability. Translate business goals into practical solutions that drive long-term success.


️ **Architect & Implement** – Design and refine **robust, cloud-native solutions** (AWS, Docker, Kubernetes). Leverage front-end or full-stack insights to ensure seamless user experiences when necessary.


**Operational Coordination** – Work closely with the Product team to align development efforts with business objectives. Document architectural decisions to provide clarity and consistency across teams.


**Cross-Functional Collaboration** – Partner with DevOps and other technical teams to **maintain efficient CI/CD pipelines** and deployment processes. Communicate complex technical challenges and solutions in a clear, constructive manner.


**Continuous Improvement** – Stay ahead of **SaaS, cloud, and CPQ trends**, identifying opportunities to enhance platform performance, security, and scalability.

  


**Skills & Qualifications**

  

* **10+ years** of experience in software development, ideally within complex systems.
* Strong **architectural mindset**, identifying synergies across products (CPQ, VIZ, CAD) and future solutions.
* You are an open-minded **team player** who values discussion over rigid solutions—you listen, adapt, and collaborate rather than dictate.
* Proven track record in **architecting and delivering SaaS solutions** (CPQ experience is a plus).
* Expertise in **cloud environments** (AWS, Azure, GCP), **containerization** (Kubernetes, Docker), and **scalable database design** (SQL/NoSQL).
* **Backend development** expertise (Java or similar) with a willingness to engage in front-end when needed.
* **Fluent in English**; Swedish is a plus.
* We believe in **real-time collaboration** and prefer you to be **on-site most weekdays** at our Stockholm office to foster direct knowledge sharing and innovation.
* 

**The recruitment process consists of:**

* + Screening call with Talent Acquisition
	+ First interview with our hiring manager
	+ Technical interview
	+ Interview with our CPO
	+ Reference check

**Why Tacton?**

  

**Stability & Growth** – With over 20 years in the CPQ space and strong, committed ownership, we invest in long-term success.


**Technical Impact** – Play a key role in shaping architectural decisions and driving the evolution of our B2B SaaS platform.

  

**Collaborative Team** – Work alongside highly skilled senior developers in an environment that values learning, knowledge-sharing, and innovation.


**Comprehensive Benefits** – Enjoy a competitive benefits package designed to support your well-being and work-life balance.

**Our Culture and Why You Belong**  

Collaborative, Engaged, Trustworthy, Customer-Oriented, Visionary—if these values resonate with you, we’d love to hear from you!


At Tacton, we celebrate diversity and strive to create an inclusive environment where everyone feels welcome. Our team consists of people from all over the world, and we believe this diversity makes us stronger.


As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we’re committed to fostering an environment where everyone can thrive. With our comprehensive onboarding program, you’ll be set up for success from day one.


We look forward to your application—apply soon as we review candidates on a rolling basis.

 **About Tacton**  

*Tacton is a leading Software as a Service company trusted by global manufacturers. We got started in the late 1990’s when six computer scientists figured out a revolutionary way to help Manufacturers overcome their most business-critical, product configuration challenges. Since those early days, we have grown to support global manufacturers seeking to thrive in a changing world.*

*We invite you to find out more about us @* *www.tacton.com/about*

title: Infrastructure Engineer within Digital Site Services
description:
*Research shows that women and other under-represented groups within our industry hesitate to apply unless they tick most boxes of a role description. At Stegra, we are building an impact company with sustainability at its core. We need a diverse, inclusive, and authentic team to rally behind our purpose of de-carbonizing hard-to-abate industries, starting with steel.*  

  

*So, i**f you are equally passionate about our purpose yet concerned that your experience doesn**’**t* *perfectly* *align with the qualifications stated in the job advert, we strongly encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate, either for this role – or for another upcoming role in our* *rapidly* *growing* *business**.*

**About us:**


Stegra, formerly know as H2 Green Steel, is on a mission to disrupt the global steel industry by producing green steel, with the end goal of bringing down CO2 emissions to zero. By using green hydrogen and fossil-free electricity instead of coal; water and heat will be our primary emissions. By 2030, our ambition is to produce 5 million tonnes of green steel annually in our fully integrated, digitalized, and sustainable plant in Boden, located in northern Sweden - currently in construction phase. But this is just the beginning – our expertise in green hydrogen will enable us to decarbonize other industries in addition to steel, and we look forward to what’s next in store for us.


We are looking for talented, innovative, and purpose-driven people to join our rapidly growing and diverse team. Our employees get to learn everyday, implement the latest technology and test and put their ideas into practice. Together, we are building an impact company with sustainability at its core – for our people, customers, investors, society, and planet.

 **Infrastructure Engineer - Digital Site Services**


Are you ready to lead the development and operations of advanced, hyper-converged digital infrastructure? As **Infrastructure Engineer**, you’ll play a vital role in designing and maintaining the systems that power our Digital Factory. Join the **Digital Site Services** team, where we deliver secure, resilient, and innovative infrastructure solutions, including fully redundant datacenters. Based in Boden and part of Strega’s dynamic digital team, you’ll ensure our platforms drive productivity, safety, and sustainability.


**We are looking for** Infrastructure Engineers at different levels of seniority to join our Digital Site Services team. Whether you have a strong technical background with a hands-on approach or bring senior expertise and are interested in taking on a more leading role within the team, we encourage you to apply. Your level of responsibility will be adapted based on your experience and aspirations.


Read more about the knowledge and skills we are looking for in the section below.

**Responsibilities:**

As Infrastructure Engineer, you will:

* Oversee the deployment, commissioning, and configuration of digital infrastructure, including both hardware and software.
* Configure and operate physical servers, storage, backup systems, datacenter support functions, as well as virtualization environments (both on-premises and in the cloud).
* Work closely with team members and vendors to design digital infrastructure and implement best practices.
* Define operational processes for monitoring and maintaining infrastructure, ensuring secure, efficient, and reliable operations.
* Develop plans for maintenance and support to minimize downtime and ensure smooth operations.
* Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business needs, prioritize infrastructure requirements, and ensure a safe and robust platform while improving productivity, safety, and sustainability in the factory.
* Create and document best practices, and mentor team members to foster growth and improve infrastructure operations.
* Participate in an on-call rotation together with other team members to support the 24/7 operation of critical infrastructure.

  

**Q****ualifications:**


We understand that you might not meet every requirement, but if you bring some of these skills along with a willingness to learn and grow in the role, we’d still love to hear from you.


* A University degree or equivalent experience, Bachelor or Master’s in Engineering or Computer Science.
* Expertise with administration of Linux and Windows based systems.
* Several years of relevant experience in modern datacenter operations.
* Hands-on experience with configuring and managing virtualization environments such as VMware / Nutanix.
* Hands-on experience in Infrastructure provisioning and configuration management via infrastructure as code (IaC) – Ansible / Terraform.
* Experience with Active Directory and Users management systems.
* Experience with performance monitoring and troubleshooting for hosts, servers, databases, virtual machines, containers.
* Good knowledge of networks and network protocols.
* Experience with Data Backup solutions.
* Knowledge of Cybersecurity best practices, and experience in analyzing possible threats and vulnerabilities, embedding security standards, monitoring adherence to them, and implementing disaster recovery plans.

**Bonus points for:**

* Experience with OT infrastructure such as Historians, HMI, Scada, Edge gateways.
* Hands-on experience with Kubernetes for Containers management, deployment and scaling.
* Experience with AWS services configuration and management.
* Experience in writing scripts with at least one scripting language — such as Python, Java, JavaScript, etc.
* Experience with Agile and DevOps methodologies, and with Continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) platforms.

  

We’re seeking someone with a proactive and collaborative mindset who thrives in a dynamic environment. You excel at problem-solving, organization, and clear communication, especially when explaining technical solutions to non-technical stakeholders. Empathy for end-users and a passion for creating technology that improves their daily work are key traits we value.


**Location:** Boden, Sweden


(Yes, we help out with relocations and Visa processes).


We will review applications on an ongoing basis, so don’t hesitate to apply!

 **What we can offer you**

  

If you are passionate about making actual change and having a positive impact on society and our planet, Stegra offers a unique opportunity to be part of a fun and professional team with high ambitions.


You will get the opportunity to shape your future career together with a company focusing on creating a culture where everyone can thrive and feel a sense of belonging. In the end, we know that Stegra's growth and success is dependent on our people and we can’t wait to shape the future of steelmaking and other industries together as a team.

title: Machine Learning Engineer
description:
**About Us**
 Founded in 2015, Instabox is a Sweden-based tech company with the mission to make online shopping easier. In 2022, Instabee was founded after combining Budbee and Instabox - two leading last-mile delivery companies with three consumer-facing brands: Budbee, Instabox, and Porterbuddy. Instabee serves millions of consumers across Europe with convenient deliveries and is on track to become the leading European e-commerce enabler. Always with the merchant at heart.
   

  

 We’re fast, both in terms of parcel delivery and when it comes to growing our business. So far our journey has taken us from Sweden to the rest of Scandinavia and parts of continental Europe, but we have no plans on stopping anytime soon. As we continue to expand, the complexity of Instabee grows in parallel. With that in mind, we’re now looking for a Software Engineer with machine learning knowledge to help us govern our journey ahead!
   

  

**About The Role**
 At the Route Optimization team, you’ll play a crucial role in building, maintaining, and enhancing the models and services that drive our core operations. We follow an end-to-end approach: collecting and preprocessing data, developing and validating models, deploying these models, and integrating them into our routing engine. Your work will directly impact how Instabee optimizes its routes, empowering the business to make informed strategic decisions, improve operational efficiency, and enhance customer satisfaction.
   

  

**To Do This We’ll Expect You To**
* Build and maintain models and services and deploy them
* Take the lead on developing new features and refactoring existing code, ensuring high standards of code quality and efficiency
* Stay at the forefront of software development trends, experimenting with new approaches and technologies to continuously improve our systems
* Work closely with algorithm engineers, machine learning engineers, and the broader tech team to share ideas and support each other in achieving our goals
* Advocate for best coding practices, both within the team and across the organization, inspiring others to maintain high standards


**To Succeed In This Role You Probably**
* Love writing high-quality production-grade code
* Have 3+ years of experience as a Software Engineer or Machine Learning Engineer, working in a modern tech environment
* Experience in building and deploying machine learning models
* Strong programming skills in Python and Java. Experience with various databases is a plus
* Familiarity with Kubernetes, Helm, Docker, and other DevOps tools
* You’ve led feature development, refactoring efforts, and know how to inspire those around you


 If this is you, we really can’t wait to meet you!
   

  

**What You’ll Get**
 We can promise you that you will be challenged, develop your skills and have the opportunity to work with truly amazing and competent colleagues. If you like changes and want to set new processes and ways of working - this is the place for you!
   

  

**Benefits**
 Of course, we have all the necessary and standard benefits in place, but in addition to this, we can also offer:
   

  

 🌇 Sky-High Office: Modern and newly renovated with a 360-degree view around Stockholm.
   

  

 🐶 Puppy Friendly: Bring your dog to work - we've got a whole floor for our furry friends!
   

  

 🍸 Rooftop Fridays: Chill out at our Friday rooftop bar with the best views in town
   

  

 🥐 Wednesdays Tech Breakfasts: Fuel your midweek with tech talks and tasty bites.
   

  

 👾 Tech Demos: Dive into the latest innovations with our regular tech showcases.
   

  

 💻 Modern Tech Stack: Work with cutting-edge technology every day.
   

  

 🏓 Fun & Games: Ping pong, Shuffleboard, Foosball, and even a Karaoke Room for your leisure time.
   

  

 ⏰ Flexible Hours: Hybrid setup with working hours that adapt to your lifestyle.
   

  

 👶 Parental Pay for Six Months: Step away from work and provide the best care
   

  

 and love to your little one.
   

  

 🎂 A Day Off on Your Birthday: We love to celebrate, so enjoy your birthday to the fullest with a day off each year!
   

  

 Diversity and inclusion is very important to us and we are committed to creating an inclusive work environment. We want to be a workplace where everyone’s perspectives and opinions are valued, and we are dedicated to creating opportunities for all employees to thrive and reach their full potential.
   

  

*This recruitment process consists of background checks via Verifiera as a review of previous public criminal records. The result is public information that is handled confidentially. This is mandatory for all recruitment processes at Instabee (Instabox/Budbee) in Sweden.*
 Instabee was founded in 2022 after combining Budbee and Instabox — two leading last-mile delivery companies with three consumer-facing brands: Budbee, Instabox and Porterbuddy. Instabee is present in six countries, serving thousands of online merchants, including ASOS, Zalando, Inditex and H&M and is on track to become the most admired European e-commerce enabler.
   

  

 Since the start, Instabee has focused on consumer-centric and sustainable solutions, offering deliveries to boxes and homes using muscle power, electricity, renewable diesel and biofuels. Through bespoke technical solutions, Instabee can guarantee optimal fill rates and routing, minimising any unnecessary transports. Instabee is backed by Kinnevik, Creades and EQT, among others.

title: Systemutvecklare
description:
Brinner du för utveckling och letar efter en ny spännande och meningsfull utmaning? Hos Amendo Tech får du chansen att arbeta i framkant inom systemutveckling för några av Sveriges mest spännande företag. Just nu söker vi drivna och lösningsorienterade specialister för kommande uppdrag inom bank och finans, detaljhandel, myndigheter, produktbolag och snabbväxande startups. Vi erbjuder unika möjligheter för dig som är redo för en ny, stimulerande utmaning.
   

  

 Din kompetens & profil
   

  

 Du är erfaren inom systemutveckling och bekväm med både front- och backend, redo att skapa lösningar som gör skillnad. Vi letar efter dig som är nyfiken, engagerad och som trivs med att arbeta på varierande uppdrag.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet av att arbeta med några av dessa teknologier:
   

  

**Frontend**
* JavaScript/TypeScript: Gedigen kunskap inom modern JavaScript/TypeScript.
* Ramverk: Erfarenhet av ramverk som React, Vue eller Angular.
* HTML & CSS: Stark grund inom HTML5 och CSS3, gärna även erfarenhet av Bootstrap eller Tailwind.
* State Management: Kunskaper i bibliotek som Redux eller Vuex.


**Backend**
* Programmeringsspråk: Erfarenhet av språk som Node.js, Java, C#, Python eller Go.
* API-design: Skicklighet i att utveckla och designa RESTful API, gärna även GraphQL.
* Databaser: Kunskap i både relationsdatabaser (t.ex. PostgreSQL, MySQL) och NoSQL (t.ex. MongoDB, Redis).
* Säkerhet: Erfarenhet av säkerhetsprinciper och autentisering som OAuth, JWT eller SAML.


**DevOps och Infrastruktur**
* Molnplattformar: Erfarenhet av molntjänster som AWS, Azure eller Google Cloud Platform.
* CI/CD: Kunskap om CI/CD med verktyg som Jenkins, GitLab CI eller GitHub Actions.
* Containrar: Erfarenhet av Docker och gärna även Kubernetes.
* Versionshantering: Flytande i Git och vana vid Git-baserade arbetsflöden.


**Övrigt**
* Testning: Kunskap i testautomatisering, både frontend och backend (t.ex. Jest, Mocha, JUnit, Selenium).
* Agilt arbete: Erfarenhet av Scrum eller Kanban.
* Kommunikation och samarbete: Förmåga att arbeta effektivt i team och bidra till kunskapsutbyte.


 Du har en vilja, nyfikenhet och drivkraft att vilja skapa nytta hos kunden samt lära dig nytt. En problemlösare som inte är rädd för att ta initiativ och vågar utforska nya vägar och arbetssätt. Du har en förmåga att snabbt sätta dig in i nya sammanhang och processer. Du får saker gjorda och ser kunskapsluckor som en möjlighet för personlig utveckling. Du är analytisk och har stor förståelse för vikten av service och kommunikation.
   

  

 Som konsult kommer du att ställas inför en rad olika utmaningar, både från ett socialt och pragmatiskt perspektiv. Därför tror vi att du är öppen och ödmjuk för både förändring och olikheter. Du har ett agilt sätt att möta problem och kan se dem från olika vinklar.
   

  

 Om Amendo Tech
   

  

 Amendo Tech är din heltäckande partner inom IT och tech. Som vår konsultkollega blir du en del av ett personligt bolag som lägger stor vikt vid kompetens, mångfald och innovation. Vi ser varje medarbetares unika perspektiv som en styrka, och vi erbjuder ett öppet klimat där vi stöttar dig att nå dina mål. Tillsammans bidrar vi till att forma en bättre framtid genom teknik och kreativitet.
   

  

 Vi är ett expansivt bolag med stark lokal närvaro i Stockholm samt i sydvästra och norra Sverige. Följ Amendo Tech på Linkedin!
   

  

 Amendo Tech är en del av Amendo Group som har arbetat med framtidens kompetens sedan 2001. I koncernen ingår även Amendo Bemanning & Rekrytering och Lagotto Executive Search & Interim. Tillsammans möter vi dig där du står, och tar dig dit du vill. Vi är din engagerade och trygga kompetenspartner.
   

  

 Frågor och kontakt
   

  

 Vid frågor eller funderingar om våra konsultuppdrag är du varmt välkommen att höra av dig till Amendo Techs Kiara Bergqvist på kiara.bergqvist@amendotech.se eller Johanna Hallenberg på johanna.hallenberg@amendotech.se. Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig, varmt välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

 #IT

title: Integrationsutvecklare - sökes till Accelerate at Iver
description:
*Nu letar vi efter nya medarbetare som vill vara med på vår resa. Som en del av Accelerate at Iver ligger du i teknikens absoluta framkant och arbetar med spännande digitaliserings- och transformationsprojekt hos marknadsledande kunder. Vi är idag över 300 konsulter som brinner för att realisera digitala möjligheter i molnet. Tillsammans med våra kunder stänger vi gapet mellan aspiration och framgångsrik implementation. Nu söker vi en Integrationsutvecklare som vill bli en del av Accelerate at Iver och som vill vara med och bidra till bättre IT-lösningar som gör skillnad för våra kunder! Är du vår nya kollega?*
**Din roll** 
**på Accelerate at Iver?**
 Som integrationsutvecklare hos Accelerate at Iver kommer du att bidra till att bygga robusta, moderna och långsiktiga integrationslösningar. Lösningarna byggs främst på Microsoft-teknologi, både cloud och on-prem.
   

  

 Vi söker en social och lösningsorienterad person som trivs med att arbeta både självständigt och i team. Du har ett stort driv och gillar att hålla dig uppdaterad inom den senaste tekniken.
   

  

 Vill du vara en del av vårt team och bidra till att bygga framtidens integrationslösningar?
   

  

**Dina Arbetsuppgifter Inkluderar**
* Utveckling & Implementering: Erfarenhet av att ta fram teknisk och funktionell design för integrationslösningar. Samarbeta med integrationsarkitekter för att utveckla lösningar som uppfyller både verksamhetsmål och tekniska principer.
* Kodkvalitet & Optimering: Säkerställ högkvalitativ, underhållbar och återanvändbar kod. Förbättra befintliga integrationer för att uppnå bättre skalbarhet, säkerhet och prestanda.
* Samarbete: Arbeta självständigt eller i team tillsammans med bland annat projektledare, arkitekter, testare och produktägare.
* Support & Underhåll: Bidra till det löpande underhållet och utvecklingen av integrationslösningar.


**Vad erbjuder vi dig?**
 Accelerate at Iver kan erbjuda dig ett utmanande och varierande jobb som konsult med stora personliga utvecklingsmöjligheter! Vi satsar hårt på kompetensutveckling och att ständigt hålla oss i teknisk framkant.
   

  

 Hos Accelerate at Iver får du utvecklas tillsammans med duktiga och erfarna kollegor som har arbetat med C#, .Net Core och Microservices i flera stora och utmanade projekt de senaste åren. Våra kunder är nationella och globala både medel och stora bolag.
   

  

 Vi har intressanta, långsiktiga uppdrag och team-leveranser där du kan utvecklas och arbeta nära kollegor som delar din passion för teknik.
   

  

 Som anställd på Accelerate at Iver får du ett antal fördelar som:
   

  

* En trygg och säker anställning
* Individuellt anpassad utvecklings- och utbildningsplan
* Friskvårdsbidrag
* Hälso & sjukvårdsförsäkring
* Pensions och försäkringsrådgivning
* Förmånsportal
* Timbank & volontärdag
* Medarbetar och familjeaktiviteter i olika former


**Vi Söker Dig Som Har**
 Erfarenhet av att arbeta med teknologier som:
   

  

* C#, .NET Core, .NET Framework, XML, JSON, REST-APIer, Biceps
* Azure Integration Services: Logic Apps, Service Bus, Azure Functions, Azure API Management
* SQL Server, Azure SQL
* Azure, men meriterande med erfarenhet av andra plattformar såsom BizTalk, Mulesoft eller andra plattformar


 Kunskap om verktyg som Microsoft Visual Studio/Visual Studio Code, Postman, Git och Azure DevOps.
   

  

 Minst 2–4 års erfarenhet inom integrationsutveckling
   

  

 Du bör ha jobbat i agila team med scrum- eller kanban som arbetssätt, och vara van vid de olika rollerna och rollfördelningen som ett sådant arbetssätt innebär.
   

  

 För att trivas i rollen som konsult bör du ha lätt att skapa relationer, kunna arbeta både i team och självständigt och ha stor personlig drivkraft och lösningsfokus.
   

  

 Är du en social, flexibel och strukturerad person med stort intresse inom av arbeta med och att utvecklas inom de senaste teknologierna så tror vi du kommer passa in och trivas utmärkt hos oss!
   

  

 För denna position krävs Svenskt medborgarskap, vi utför även bakgrundskontroll av slutkandidat.
   

  

**Placeringsort**
 Iver finns på 25 platser i Sverige & Norge. För denna roll ser vi att du utgår från ett av våra kontor i Stockholm.
   

  

**Sök till oss!**
 Urval sker löpande, tjänsten kan tillsättas före sista ansökningsdag. Accelerate at Iver eftersträvar en jämn könsfördelning och värdesätter etnisk och kulturell mångfald. Önskad start är snarast eller enligt överenskommelse. Du är välkommen att kontakta Magida Musa (magida.musa@iver.se) vid frågor eller funderingar kring tjänsten. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

 Välkommen till Accelerate at Iver!

title: System Administrator
description:
**Join our global force of 500+ innovators, blending the latest in tech with the greatest in soundtracking, from our Stockholm HQ to offices in London, New York, Los Angeles, Berlin, Oslo, and Seoul. We’re an industry leader with a startup mentality. We take what we do seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Creating and collaborating to transform the sound of streaming, content, and culture. Come join us— and let the world feel your work.**

**The Role**


Are you an experienced System Administrator with a passion for managing and optimizing cloud-based workspaces in a SaaS environment? Do you thrive in a dynamic IT Operations team, enabling a creative and productive organization while keeping Security and Compliance at the forefront? If so, we want you on our team!


Our IT Operations team is responsible for maintaining and improving employee-facing systems and technologies. We work closely with IT Support, IT Engineering, and Cybersecurity teams to ensure seamless operations, security, and productivity across the organization.

**What We’re Looking For**


Are you excited about shaping and improving IT systems for a fast-growing organization? Do you have a collaborative mindset and a passion for solving business needs through smart technology? If this sounds like you, this could be your call!

**How You Will Make an Impact**

* **Ownership & Strategy:** You will own and maintain key SaaS applications such as Google Workspace and Atlassian Suite, ensuring they are optimized for scalability, security, and efficiency. Your holistic, architectural mindset will ensure seamless integration with the rest of our ecosystem.
* **Software & License Management:** You will oversee SaaS application administration, licensing, and compliance, ensuring efficient software procurement, renewals, and cost optimization.
* **Collaboration & Communication:** As part of an employee-facing team, you will translate business needs into technical solutions, improving productivity and enabling teams to work seamlessly across our platforms.
* **Problem-Solving & Critical Thinking:** You will assess technical changes and apply critical thinking to decision-making, balancing business needs, IT security, and organizational goals.
* **Generalist Approach & Execution:** You will lead, execute, and implement IT projects and change requests, configure and maintain applications, and develop processes and best practices to improve system administration.

 **What You’ll Do**

* **Administer and maintain key SaaS platforms** (e.g., Google Workspace, Atlassian Suite, and other employee-facing applications) to ensure smooth operations.
* **Manage user access, security configurations, and compliance** across multiple platforms.
* **Collaborate with internal stakeholders** to ensure systems and processes align with business needs and security best practices.
* **Handle escalated end-user cases** related to software administration, ensuring timely resolution.
* **Monitor and improve licensing and software management**, optimizing costs and compliance.
* **Implement automation and scripting** (e.g.,**Python, GAM, API integrations**) to streamline system administration and repetitive tasks.

 **Who You Are**

* **A self-starter** – You take ownership and proactively seek solutions.
* **A problem-solver** – You enjoy tackling technical challenges and finding efficient solutions.
* **A fast learner** – You stay up to date with the latest trends in IT and cloud administration.
* **A team player** – You work well with others, sharing knowledge and responsibilities.
* **An excellent communicator** – You translate technical issues into clear, understandable language.
* **A dependable professional** – You follow through on commitments and deliver quality results.
* **A lifelong learner** – You have a growth mindset and seek continuous improvement.

 **What You Bring to the Role**

* **Experience owning and managing Google Workspace and Atlassian Suite** in an enterprise environment.
* **Strong knowledge of SaaS application administration, access management, and compliance.**
* **Experience with software licensing management** and procurement best practices.
* **Knowledge of common scripting languages and command-line tools** (e.g., **GAM, PowerShell, Python, or Bash**).
* **Familiarity with automation and API integrations** to optimize workflows.
* **Excellent communication skills** – You can engage with both technical and non-technical teams.
* **Preferred but not required:** Google Workspace Professional Certification or equivalent experience.

 **Why Join Us?**

* **Be part of a collaborative, forward-thinking IT team** where your work directly impacts the organization.
* **Work with modern tools and technologies** in a fast-growing, cloud-first environment.
* **Opportunity to shape the IT landscape** and improve processes that drive efficiency and security.

  

Are you ready to take the next step in your career? **Apply today and be a part of our team!**

 **Equal opportunity employer**


We believe that bringing people together from different backgrounds, experiences and perspectives makes for a healthy workplace, a more successful business and a better world. We value diversity and encourage everyone to come and soundtrack the world with us.

**Application**


Ready to make the world feel your work? Please apply, in English, by clicking the link “interested” below.

title: Microsoft Technical Specialist Europe
description:
**About This Team:**  

include 2-3 lines about your team and what they do within the organization and company.  

  

**Job Description/Responsibilities:**

* Implements strategic goals established by functional leadership.
* Establishes operational plans for job area with short-to mid-term impact on results (e.g., 1-2 years).
* Provides measurable input into new products, processes, standards and/or operational plans that will have some impact on the achievement of overall function results.
* Responsible for improving upon existing processes and systems using significant conceptualizing, reasoning and interpretation.
* Problems and issues faced are numerous, typically undefined where information is difficult to obtain.
* Conducts extensive investigation to understand root cause of problems.
* Problems span a wide range of difficult and unique issues across functions and/or businesses.
* Communicates with parties within and outside of own job function, and typically has responsibilities for communicating with parties external to the organization, which may include customers or vendors.
* Works to influence others to accept job function’s view/practices and agree/accept new concepts, practices, and approaches.
* Requires ability to communicate with executive leadership regarding matters of significant importance to the organization.
* Frequently responsible for providing guidance, coaching and training to other employees across the Company within area of expertise.
* Typically responsible for managing large, complex project initiatives of strategic importance to the organization, involving large cross-functional teams.
  
* 
* **Required Experience/Skills:**
* Requires mastery level knowledge of job area typically obtained through advanced education combined with experience. May have deep knowledge of project management.
* Typically requires a University Degree or equivalent experience and minimum 12 years of prior relevant experience; or Master’s degree with 8 years; or PhD with 5 years of experience.
* Recognized master in professional discipline
* Implements strategic goals
* Problems typically undefined and/or complex
  
* 
* **Optional Experience/Skills:**
* additional languages

**About Us:**


Citrix and TIBCO recently merged to create Cloud Software Group, now one of the world’s largest cloud solution providers, serving more than 100 million users around the globe. When you join Cloud Software Group, you are making a difference for real people, each of whom count on our suite of cloud-based products to get work done — from anywhere. Members of our team will tell you that we value diverse lived experiences, passion for technology, and the courage to take risks. Everyone is empowered to learn, dream, and build the future of work. We are on the brink of another Cambrian leap - a moment of immense evolution and growth. And we need your expertise and experience to do it. Now is the perfect time to move your skills to the cloud.


Cloud Software Group is firmly committed to Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) and to compliance with all federal, state and local laws that prohibit employment discrimination. If you need a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during any part of the application process, please contact us at (800) 424-8749 or email us at AskHR@cloud.com for assistance.

title: Deep Learning Engineer
description:
At Univrses we develop computer vision and machine learning technology for smart cities, and self-driving vehicles. Univrses is now looking for a Deep Learning Engineer to join the team in Stockholm!


Our product 3DAI revolutionizes urban and highway road management by providing timely, actionable insights about road conditions through AI powered live maps. As a result it empowers businesses, municipalities, and road transport authorities to make data-driven decisions, optimize their operations, and increase urban safety.


The team consists of talented, hard-working, and friendly people from all over the world with diverse backgrounds and expert knowledge in computer vision, robotics, machine learning, physics, math, software development and more. We develop cutting edge technology, particularly in the fields of computer vision and deep learning.

**Your role**  

You will be part of the team responsible for the data curation, computer vision, and deep learning components of 3DAI.


We are looking for a person who is knowledgeable in the state of the art in deep learning, and has a strong interest in applying their knowledge to real-world problems. They also recognize the importance of data quality and automation in building scalable, reliable systems, and are eager to contribute to the development of high-quality, user-friendly tools for these systems.

**Responsibilities:**

* Develop and test deep learning models for object detection, classification, and segmentation.
* Streamline the deployment and scaling of computer vision models in production environments.
* Design and implement monitoring and logging solutions to track the performance of our system on both controlled test sets and in the wild.
* Develop learning based methods to ease data curation and annotation through automation.
* Work closely with other teams to develop end to end KPIs for performance monitoring and trouble shooting.
* Optimize and scale ML infrastructure to handle large volumes of image data efficiently.

**Who you are**

* Minimum of a Master's degree in Computer Science, Math, Physics, Robotics, or a related field.
* Over 5 years of proven experience in developing computer vision or deep learning technologies.
* Proficient in programming, particularly Python, and experienced with ML frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch).
* Strong theoretical foundation in deep learning and best practices.
* Solid understanding of version control systems, especially Git.
* Exceptional communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to thrive in a team-oriented environment.
* Self-motivated with a keen focus on quality and scalability.
* Motivated to see your ideas brought to life in production.
* Flexible, eager to learn, and excited to take on diverse tech challenges.

**Bonus points**

* Knowledge of classical computer vision and projective geometry.
* Experience with data annotation and curation tools such as Labelbox, and Voxel 51.
* Experience with AWS and Serverless frameworks, or other cloud platforms.
* Experience with containerization and developing CI/CD pipelines.
* Experience with Jenkins.

**What we offer**

* Bright and spacious facilities in the heart of Stockholm
* Open and friendly work environment
* A diverse, international, and friendly team
* Generous employee benefits, such as:
	+ Flexible work hours
	+ 5 000 SEK/year in wellness grant
	+ Pension plan
